message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.SY, cs.SE, cs.DC 

This paper primarily focuses on the security of IoT devices and proposes a novel architecture for virtualizing network functions to provide IoT security. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also discusses the vulnerabilities of IoT devices and the need for security measures, which falls under the category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The proposed architecture involves the use of virtualization, which can be categorized under cs.SY (Systems and Control). The paper also discusses the limitations of conventional centralized IT security measures, which can be categorized under cs.SE (Software Engineering). Finally, the proposed architecture aims to improve the performance of IoT security, which can be categorized under cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing).
